Package musichub.main

Class Application

java.lang.Object
musichub.main.Application
public class Application
extends java.lang.Object
Represents the application and all its possible functions, that compose MusicHub
See Also:
Application, ConsoleUserDisplay, MusicHub, Song, AudioBook, AudioElement, Album, Playlist, Genres, Languages, Categories

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Application()
    Creates a new Application object, and creates the associated xml files

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addAlbum​(Album album)
    Add a new album to the list albums
    void addAudioBook​(AudioBook book)
    Add an new audio book to the list audioBooks

    Creates a new playlist from a name and elements asked to the user

    Deletes a playlist, knowing its name

    Displays a list of albums, ordered by date

    Displays a list of all the audio books

    Displays some indications at the console to help the user to understand the functions
    void loadAll()
    Loads in the different lists all the data from xml files, at the starting of the program
    void saveAll()
    Saves all the data in the xml files, in order to not loose them

    • getElementWithID

      public static AudioElement getElementWithID​(int id) throws ElementNotFoundException
      Returns the element (song or audiobook) with the corresponding id
      Parameters:
      id - the id to search for
      Returns:
      the element if found
      Throws:
      ElementNotFoundException - if there is no element with such an id

    • getSongWithID

      Returns the song with the corresponding id
      Parameters:
      id - the id to search for
      Returns:
      the song if found
      Throws:
      ElementNotFoundException - if there is no song with such an id

      a list of albums

    • createNewId

      public int createNewId​(int elm)
      Generates and returns a new ID for a given element
      Parameters:
      elm - the element for which to generate an ID, 1 is a song or an audio book, 2 is an album
      Returns:
      an new ID

    • addSongToAlbum

      public void addSongToAlbum​(java.lang.String songTitle, java.lang.String albumTitle) throws ElementNotFoundException
      Add a song to an album, both already existing
      Parameters:
      songTitle - the song's title
      albumTitle - the album's title
      Throws:
      ElementNotFoundException - if one these elements does not exist

    • createPlaylist

      public void createPlaylist​(java.lang.String name)
      Creates a new playlist from a name and elements asked to the user
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the new playlist

    • deletePlaylist

      public void deletePlaylist​(java.lang.String name) throws ElementNotFoundException
      Deletes a playlist, knowing its name
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the playlist to delete
      Throws:
      ElementNotFoundException - if the playlist does not exist
